tweets.text:
Flood Warnings have been issued for multiple locations along the Mersey Estuary, in #FiddlersFerry, #ArpleyBridge & #VictoriaPark for 23:00 this evening.

For details, visit https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn

#prepareactsurvive #floodaware #Merseyside #Warrington #Knutsford

Do you know how to survive a flood? Survivalist Megan Hine explains the three things you need to know üëá 

Over 5 million UK homes are at risk of flooding. Don't assume it won't happen to you.

https://t.co/CsUTBjY5Ft 

#FloodActionWeek #PrepareActSurvive

@Meg_Hine https://t.co/Bf3koSXpds
@Lussas @EnvAgency @newforestranger @Havant_Enviro @LymoTweetUp No I haven‚Äôt. Although can‚Äôt see it being the amazing sea eagles, they would have taken any eaten them?! Probably stormy weather?

tweets.text: Take care around #NDevon‚Äôs coast as we head towards a big high tide in the next hour.  Thank you to @DC_Police and @EnvAgencySW for being in #Instow.  Our flood gate may be closed shortly. https://t.co/FXaPcKB49u
Lots of dead Gurnard washed up on Milford-on -Sea beach at the moment. Why?  @EnvAgency @newforestranger @Havant_Enviro @lymotweetup. https://t.co/k93bUfST38

@Lussas @EnvAgency @newforestranger @Havant_Enviro I saw someone talking about this yesterday Gill! Suggestions were the sea eagles from IOW or just the storms ü§î @LymKeyRanger @BirdAwareSolent @Chazzeremily @newforestranger ?

Very disappointed that neither of our district councillors for the Longstanton/Northstowe/Oakington ward were willing to put a motion forward to @SouthCambs requiring full transparency on the investigation into the status of the aquifer beneath Longstanton and Northstowe. https://t.co/4huX7m5g1h https://t.co/GXeGd5VHKx

Sneak peek üëÄ on how the underwater viewing window is taking shape at our Diglis #FishPass. It will be such a special experience - descending those stairs to look out on the fish within the river! üêüüêüüêü @severnrivers @CRTWalesandSW @EnvAgencyMids #FishPassage https://t.co/xcNs6OYDvM

Large waves along the coast in parts of north-west, south and south-west England on Saturday and Sunday could lead to minor flooding. Minor surface water and river impacts are also expected in south-east England on Sunday. 

Sign up for flood warnings: https://t.co/60gMJ48T7b

A year on from devastating flooding, some residents in Fishlake, South Yorkshire, still aren‚Äôt able to return home. I‚Äôm live on ‚Å¶@BBCBreakfast‚Å© speaking to villagers and the ‚Å¶@EnvAgency‚Å© next https://t.co/my3fXwaQcw

Would you know what to do if a flood was forecast in your area? 

This winter, learn the simple steps that will keep the things that you love safe:

üéíPrepare
 üè†Act
 ‚òéSurvive

üëâ Learn what to do in a flood:
https://t.co/3jQgAKyHL1  

#PrepareActSurvive #FloodActionWeek https://t.co/a1rA4Vo9Y8

Beautiful brown trout filmed this week in the #Trent at @StaffsUni. Fish of this size may now be reaching this part of the river because the new channel at the Victoria Ground bypasses two weirs, which were a barrier to fish passage. 
@EnvAgencyMids @CraigBennett3 @WildTroutTrust https://t.co/B65vmWzYs9

urls.title: What to do in a flood - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text:
Check out the 5 things you can do this #FloodActionWeek to be better prepared for a flood.

Take action to protect yourself, your family and your home now. üëá

https://t.co/PzDbHFZ82f

#PrepareActSurvive #FloodActionWeek https://t.co/aET9YqHUQ7

Minor coastal flooding is expected in parts of north-west and south-west England on Saturday and Sunday.

Stay safe and stay away from coastal paths, piers and promenades where there are strong waves or tides.

Sign up for flood warnings: https://t.co/60gMJ3RifD https://t.co/Bad0ntkwkS

For @EnvAgency #FloodActionWeek, we're taking a look at the work happening across the Partnership this winter that will help to reduce flooding. Here's a look at what we're up to in the Midlands @EnvAgencyMids, and why slowing the flow of water from the hills is so important #NFM https://t.co/SKw5Dn7vHU

The @EnvAgency has started to issue enforcement notices to companies that have not submitted an ESOS Phase 2 report. Here's the low down on how you can get caught up on ESOS and avoid paying eye-watering fines.

https://t.co/sEevuVjLHL

We love to see Natural Flood Management in action!

#NFM forms part of the mosaic of measures which can help reduce the risk of #flooding. By working with @moorsforfuture we can create more of these schemes & use our natural habitats to build up flood resilience

#FloodActionWeek https://t.co/TerjQekFBP

tweets.text:
River word of the day: riffle! This is an area where shallow water flows rapidly over gravel, agitating the flow. As a result the water here is highly oxgenated, which is favoured by spawning trout and bullheads. Lots of riffles in the new channel in #StokeOnTrent!
@EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/ewsqvsq1Sz
Join @BSI_UK on 25 November to learn more about flood resilience standards and from @EnvAgency on work to renew the #PFR framework by summer 2021 https://t.co/AvuC32sgQ7

Day 14 #30DayMapChallenge with @OrdnanceSurvey #climatechange - surface water flood modelling in Leicester for Local Action Project. Maps show results of a 100-year rainfall event (left) and the EA Surface Water Flood Zones right as a comparison #mapping @EnvAgencySW https://t.co/N29qQmfMin

Day 13- #30DayMapChallenge
Theme: Raster.

@EnvAgency Tree Planting data from 2010 to today was displayed in a heat map. This theme inspired me to learn more about the features @ArcGISOnline offers. I aim to integrate skills learnt into future work. 
https://t.co/ZjvaT8Snhc

Theme: Map not made with GIS software.

tweets.text: "Our absolute priority is to be ready for this winter. We're increasing the flood defences' height in Fishlake. We've got a ¬£12.8m scheme to repair damage in South Yorkshire & 6,500 staff on standby to act when needed" - @OliverHarmarEA & his team at the @EnvAgency https://t.co/40E3zHnUJ2

Their Belt And Road projects in many countries are now ecological disasters.

China's militant fishing fleets are systematically destroying marine environments everywhere.

BUT ALL  GREEN  GROUPS  ARE  SILENT! https://t.co/6Er52Jlxbn

@AnglianWater @RDW1 @KarenShackleto5 @theriverstrust @WildTroutTrust @EnvAgencyAnglia @jamesowild @N_Rivers_Trust @The_WMA @Feargal_Sharkey Surprised that you are not already looking into this.
